The Medieval period, or Middle Ages, lasted from the 5th to the 15th century and was a time of political, social, and cultural change in Europe. During this period, feudalism was the dominant political system, and the Catholic Church held immense religious and political power.

The Medieval period, which is generally considered to have lasted from the 5th to the 15th centuries, is the period of European history between the fall of the Roman Empire and the beginning of the Renaissance.
